text: Bromine trifluoride is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is BrF3. It contains bromine and fluoride ions. The bromine is in its +3 oxidation state. ==Properties== It is a yellow liquid. It absorbs water and reacts when placed in water. It can be dissolved in concentrated sulfuric acid. It conducts electricity. It can dissolve other fluorides. ==Preparation== It is made by reacting cold fluorine with bromine. Hot fluorine makes bromine pentafluoride. ==Uses== It is used to make uranium hexafluoride for uranium making. This makes the uranium able to explode in an atomic bomb. ==Related pages== *Bromine monochloride *Bromine dioxide Category:Bromine compounds Category:Fluorine compounds
